full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 753 Filed 08/10/22 Page 73 of 264 1499
LC7Cmax2 Flatley - cross
drives, but I couldn't tell you if it was that one.
Q. And you don't know who he is or what that means; correct?
A. No, ma'am.
Q. When you examined that hard drive, you don't have the device, the computer that that hard drive was in; correct?
A. That is correct.
Q. You don't know if it was from a desktop computer; right?
A. I can make -- actually, yes, I can say it was from a desktop computer.
Q. So not a laptop computer?
A. Correct.
Q. In a stationary place; right?
A. Correct.
Q. People don't usually take their desktops with them on airplanes, for example; right?
MS. POMERANTZ: Objection.
THE COURT: Sustained.
Q. A desktop is more difficult to transport than a laptop; is that fair to say?
A. Yes, ma'am.
Q. So when you examined this hard drive, you actually learned that the hard drive itself was a clone of some other hard drive; right?
A. That is correct.
Q. So you made a clone of a clone?
SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00018671
